traveler.goal: Meet Andrew for at least 105 minutes while visiting San Francisco and maximize the number of friends met; primary objective is to satisfy the Andrew meeting constraint.

private_information: I will be at Union Square from 11:15 to 17:15
andrew.goal: Be available to meet at Union Square between 11:15 and 17:15 and coordinate meeting duration.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate agent schedules and produce a PDDL domain and problem for the FastDownward solver that encodes travel durations, time windows, meeting duration constraints, and an objective to maximize meetings while ensuring Andrew is met for at least 105 minutes.

public_information: You are visiting San Francisco for the day and want to meet as many friends as possible.
Travel times in minutes: Presidio to Union Square 22, Union Square to Presidio 24.
Andrew will be at Union Square from 11:15 to 17:15.
You would like to meet Andrew for a minimum of 105 minutes.

schedule.system_prompt: You are an expert travel scheduler. Provide a clear planned timeline, available windows for meeting, estimated travel durations between locations, and any constraints or preferences. Do not emit PDDL. Base your output on public and private information.
schedule.prompt: Your name is traveler. Public information: {environment->public_information} Private information: {agents->traveler->private_information} Goal: {agents->traveler->goal} Provide your timeline, available meeting windows, and travel considerations including earliest departure times and any flexibility.

schedule.system_prompt: You are an availability coordinator for Andrew. Provide precise availability windows, earliest and latest possible meeting start times, and any flexibility. Do not emit PDDL.
schedule.prompt: Your name is andrew. Public information: {environment->public_information} Private information: {agents->andrew->private_information} Goal: {agents->andrew->goal} Provide availability details, possible preferred meeting durations, and any constraints on meeting location or time.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent temporal PDDL and optimization for FastDownward. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem tailored to the FastDownward planner. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep agent actions distinct. Model discrete travel durations, time windows, meeting duration constraints, and an objective to maximize meetings while ensuring Andrew is met for at least 105 minutes.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate these schedules: {traveler_schedule} and {andrew_schedule}. Use public information: {environment->public_information}. Produce a PDDL domain and problem for FastDownward that encodes locations Presidio and Union Square, travel durations Presidio->Union Square 22 and Union Square->Presidio 24 (minutes), initial time arrival 09:00, Andrew availability 11:15-17:15, and a constraint requiring at least 105 minutes of meeting with Andrew. Keep traveler and Andrew actions distinct. Enclose domain in <domain></domain> and problem in <problem></problem>.
